In 2024, the league took concrete steps in that direction, expanding the number of international roster spots from five per team to seven. This effectively lowered the barriers for clubs to recruit top international players. The new collective bargaining agreement with the playersâ€™ union, approved in 2024, also increased the base salary cap from $3.3million for the 2025 season to at least $5.1m by 2030, with all-guaranteed contracts and a playerâ€™s base pay supplemented by a new revenue-sharing agreement.
